definition.core: Represents how the individual forms, stabilizes, updates, and defends their internal identity. Determines narrative style, worldview formation, self-coherence, and susceptibility to identity distortion or fragmentation.

axes.internal_identity_reference: Constructs identity from internal values, personal standards, and intrinsic meaning.
axes.external_identity_reference: Constructs identity from feedback, roles, expectations, and relational validation.
axes.rigid_identity_framework: Maintains a fixed, inflexible sense of self; low adaptability to new information.
axes.fluid_identity_framework: Highly adaptive or shifting sense of self; open to redefinition and reinterpretation.

behavioral_markers: consistency or volatility in self-description across situations
sensitivity to validation or criticism in identity-relevant areas
tendencies toward narrative coherence or fragmentation
identity anchoring through roles, achievements, or relationships
